subject: World Cup (Skiing)
lead_paragraph: Lindsey Vonn of the United States moved to the top of the women’s World Cup overall standings by winning her second consecutive event, a super-combined Saturday in St. Anton Am Arlberg, Austria.Her teammate Julia Mancuso was third for the second straight race.Vonn, who won the downhill Friday, was the leader after the downhill leg of the combined. She retained the lead with her slalom run and had a total time of 2 minutes 20.28 seconds. She has three World Cup victories this season.Maria Riesch of Germany took second, 0.63 seconds back, and Mancuso was 0.65 behind.Vonn, who had been fourth in the standings, took the lead with 474 points, ahead of Nicole Hosp of Austria (419) and Riesch (389). Mancuso was sixth (364).
